title: Dcubed to demonstrate in-space manufacturing of solar arrays
summary:
German satellite component company Dcubed is moving into in-space manufacturing with a series of missions to demonstrate production of large solar arrays in orbit.
The post Dcubed to demonstrate in-space manufacturing of solar arrays appeared first on SpaceNews.

summary:

title: Guiding Artemis: Brian Alpert Turns Lessons Learned Into Lunar Progress
summary: Brian Alpert’s path was always destined for the aerospace industry, but his journey turned toward NASA’s Johnson Space Center during his sophomore year in college. title: Watch: HydroGNSS, IRIDE and Greek mission satellites launch
summary: The European Space Agency’s HydroGNSS, a twin-satellite mission to gather data on Earth’s water cycle, is scheduled to launch on 19 November at 19:18 CET (10:18 Pacific Time). Live coverage of the launch will be shown on ESA Web TV.

title: US-Based Launch Aggregator Purchases Dedicated Isar Aerospace Flight
summary:
Texas-based small satellite launch aggregator SEOPS has signed a launch services agreement with Isar Aerospace for a dedicated flight aboard the company’s Spectrum rocket. Isar Aerospace launched the inaugural flight of its Spectrum rocket in March, which ultimately failed when the vehicle exploded just metres after liftoff. The company is now preparing for Spectrum’s second […]
The post US-Based Launch Aggregator Purchases Dedicated Isar Aerospace Flight appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: SEOPS buys Spectrum launch from Isar Aerospace
summary:
SEOPS, an American mission services provider, has purchased a Spectrum launch from Isar Aerospace to broaden launch options for its customers.
The post SEOPS buys Spectrum launch from Isar Aerospace appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: How drones are altering contemporary warfare
summary:
Cambridge, MA (SPX) Nov 14, 2025


A new book by scholar and military officer Erik Lin-Greenberg examines the evolving dynamics of military and state action centered around drones.

title: NATO allies ditch Boeing for new surveillance planes
summary:
Brussels, Belgium (AFP) Nov 13, 2025


 NATO countries have ditched plans to buy US-made Boeing aircraft to replace the alliance's ageing fleet of surveillance planes, after Washington pulled out of the programme, the Netherlands said Thursday.  

The Western military alliance had announced in 2023 that members would acquire six Boeing Wedgetail jets in one of its "biggest-ever" joint purchases as it looked to bolster its capabiliti
